properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An intense frontal system is currently moving through the south coast. Rain will begin to ease to isolated showers later this afternoon. A further 10 mm is possible this afternoon. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-01-24T03:04:22-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-01-23T21:30:22-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3603751440.2020
Area: Howe Sound
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in blowing snow tonight through Saturday. A weather system will continue to give snow to the northern Yukon into this weekend. Northeasterly winds are expected to develop this evening and increase in strength overnight. These strong winds will lead to significantly reduced visibilities in blowing snow. Conditions are not expected to improve until at least Saturday. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-01-24T12:45:09-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-01-23T20:46:09-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0518184469.2020
Area: Old Crow
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory For The Village Of Pleasantdale
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for Village of Pleasantdale. This advisory is for the Village of Pleasantdale and for any individuals who may access water the Pleasantdale water system. This advisory is in effect until further notice.

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, is expected. An intense frontal system is currently crossing Vancouver Island. Heavy rain over west Vancouver Island will ease late this morning. Total rainfall accumulations of 100 mm are expected except up to 120 mm near Zeballos and Tahsis. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-01-24T03:04:46-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-01-23T12:56:46-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4167506803.2020
Area: West Vancouver Island
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills is expected. Extreme cold wind chills of -50 and colder have developed at Iqaluit today. The cold will persist through the night and into Friday before moderating somewhat. However, there is potential for the extreme cold to return Friday night and Saturday night. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Risks are greater for young children, older adults, people with chronic illnesses, people working or exercising outdoors, and those without proper shelter. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-01-24T10:07:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-01-23T18:08:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3982608084.2020
Area: Iqaluit
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with gusty winds and persistent visibility near zero in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. Winds have started to pick-up this morning and should increase further through the day. Periods of snow are expected into Saturday morning. Visibilities in blowing snow will deteriorate through the morning, with blizzard conditions persisting into Saturday morning. ### Travel is expected to be extremely hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 4 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2020-01-24T10:02:42-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-01-23T18:03:42-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1120625084.2020
Area: Dempster
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills is expected. Extreme cold wind chills of -55 and colder will develop at Hall Beach and Igloolik tonight. The extreme wind chill will persist into Friday morning before moderating slightly for the afternoon. However, extreme cold is expected to return again Friday night and potentially into Saturday as well. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Risks are greater for young children, older adults, people with chronic illnesses, people working or exercising outdoors, and those without proper shelter. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: AIR QUALITY ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR SMITHERS (January 22, 2020 - Smithers) The Ministry of Environment and Climate Change Strategy in collaboration with Northern Health and the Town of Smithers has issued an Air Quality Advisory for Smithers because of high concentrations of fine particulate matter. This advisory is in effect until further notice. Persons with chronic underlying medical conditions should postpone strenuous exercise until the advisory is lifted. Staying indoors and in air conditioned spaces helps to reduce fine particulate exposure. Exposure is particularly a concern for pregnant women, infants, the elderly and those who have diabetes, and lung or heart disease. For the duration of this advisory the use of woodstoves is prohibited within the Town of Smithers, unless the woodstove is the only source of heat in a dwelling. Real-time air quality observations and information regarding the health effects of air pollution can be found at: https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2020-01-24T07:39:58-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2020-01-23T15:40:58-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3963104774.2020
Area: Bulkley Valley
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of very cold wind chills continues. The coldest wind chill values will be between minus 55 and minus 60. Extreme cold conditions are expected to last until Friday afternoon for parts of the eastern Kitikmeot. ### Extreme cold puts everyone at risk. Risks are greater for young children, older adults, people with chronic illnesses, people working or exercising outdoors, and those without proper shelter. properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with poor visibility in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. A low pressure system will move into Davis Strait tonight bringing with it strong northwest winds and blowing snow. Blizzard conditions with poor visibilities in blowing snow are expected to begin after midnight and last into Friday morning, when winds are expected to abate. Visibilities will improve Friday morning. ### Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 6 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-01-24T11:59:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-01-23T20:00:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1262896595.2020
Area: Clyde River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing rain possible Friday night. Rain will move into the highway 7 corridor late Friday afternoon and spread north towards Georgian Bay during the evening hours. Over higher elevations, primarily north of a line from Mitchell to St Jacobs to Guelph, this rain may change to freezing rain Friday evening. The precipitation is likely to change to snow overnight or early Saturday morning. It is possible that freezing rain may persist into Saturday morning over the highest terrain of the Dundalk Highlands where ice accretion up to 5 mm is possible. Freezing rain warnings may be issued as details become more certain. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-01-24T13:17:25-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-01-23T21:18:25-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2051612176.2020

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A long period of snowfall with total amounts of 20 to 25 cm is expected. A Pacific frontal system will move into the southern BC interior today bringing heavy snow to Kootenay Pass. Warm air moving into the interior will cause snow levels to rise today, and snow will change to rain over lower elevations. However, near Kootenay Pass snow is expected to continue with snowfall amounts of 20 to 25 cm expected by Friday morning. ### Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2020-01-24T04:23:35-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-01-23T12:24:35-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3484263710.2020
Area: Highway 3 - Paulson Summit to Kootenay Pass
